message_1:
A traveling salesman has to visit 5 cities (A, B, C, D, E) and return to the starting city. The distances between the cities are as follows:

- A to B: 2 miles
- A to C: 3 miles
- A to D: 5 miles
- A to E: 4 miles
- B to C: 4 miles
- B to D: 4 miles
- B to E: 5 miles
- C to D: 3 miles
- C to E: 2 miles
- D to E: 4 miles

What is the shortest possible distance the salesman can travel to complete the journey, starting and ending at city A, and visiting each city exactly once?
message_2:
To find the shortest possible distance, we will use the brute force method by listing all possible routes and calculating the total distance for each route. Since the salesman starts and ends at city A, we only need to consider the permutations of cities B, C, D, and E.

1. B-C-D-E: A-B (2) + B-C (4) + C-D (3) + D-E (4) + E-A (4) = 17 miles
2. B-C-E-D: A-B (2) + B-C (4) + C-E (2) + E-D (4) + D-A (5) = 17 miles
3. B-D-C-E: A-B (2) + B-D (4) + D-C (3) + C-E (2) + E-A (4) = 15 miles
4. B-D-E-C: A-B (2) + B-D (4) + D-E (4) + E-C (2) + C-A (3) = 15 miles
5. B-E-C-D: A-B (2) + B-E (5) + E-C (2) + C-D (3) + D-A (5) = 17 miles
6. B-E-D-C: A-B (2) + B-E (5) + E-D (4) + D-C (3) + C-A (3) = 17 miles

7. C-B-D-E: A-C (3) + C-B (4) + B-D (4) + D-E (4) + E-A (4) = 19 miles
8. C-B-E-D: A-C (3) + C-B (4) + B-E (5) + E-D (4) + D-A (5) = 21 miles
9. C-D-B-E: A-C (3) + C-D (3) + D-B (4) + B-E (5) + E-A (4) = 19 miles
10. C-D-E-B: A-C (3) + C-D (3) + D-E (4) + E-B (5) + B-A (2) = 17 miles
11. C-E-B-D: A-C (3) + C-E (2) + E-B (5) + B-D (4) + D-A (5) = 19 miles
12. C-E-D-B: A-C (3) + C-E (2) + E-D (4) + D-B (4) + B-A (2) = 15 miles

13. D-B-C-E: A-D (5) + D-B (4) + B-C (4) + C-E (2) + E-A (4) = 19 miles
14. D-B-E-C: A-D (5) + D-B (4) + B-E (5) + E-C (2) + C-A (3) = 19 miles
15. D-C-B-E: A-D (5) + D-C (3) + C-B (4) + B-E (5) + E-A (4) = 21 miles
16. D-C-E-B: A-D (5) + D-C (3) + C-E (2) + E-B (5) + B-A (2) = 17 miles
17. D-E-B-C: A-D (5) + D-E (4) + E-B (5) + B-C (4) + C-A (3) = 21 miles
18. D-E-C-B: A-D (5) + D-E (4) + E-C (2) + C-B (4) + B-A (2) = 17 miles

19. E-B-C-D: A-E (4) + E-B (5) + B-C (4) + C-D (3) + D-A (5) = 21 miles
20. E-B-D-C: A-E (4) + E-B (5) + B-D (4) + D-C (3) + C-A (3) = 19 miles
21. E-C-B-D: A-E (4) + E-C (2) + C-B (4) + B-D (4) + D-A (5) = 19 miles
22. E-C-D-B: A-E (4) + E-C (2) + C-D (3) + D-B (4) + B-A (2) = 15 miles
23. E-D-B-C: A-E (4) + E-D (4) + D-B (4) + B-C (4) + C-A (3) = 19 miles
24. E-D-C-B: A-E (4) + E-D (4) + D-C (3) + C-B (4) + B-A (2) = 17 miles

The shortest possible distance is 15 miles, which can be achieved through routes 3, 4, and 12, and 22:

- Route 3: A-B-D-C-E-A
- Route 4: A-B-D-E-C-A
- Route 12: A-C-E-D-B-A
- Route 22: A-E-C-D-B-A
